text: [Music]
my name is byron rekitzus i'm a
principal engineer in s3 glacier
i've been at aws a little bit longer
than a year i think the biggest surprise
for me at aws is
how
hands-on the operation is i expected
when i came in that it would be like a
gleaming factory with
gleaming machinery everywhere that
nobody touches but in fact the engineers
are keenly involved with all the
services top to bottom
the reason i find the work at amazon so
motivating is that i get to work on
problems that have global impact i've
actually been asked by our vice
president to work on amazon's climate
pledge and i find that intensely
meaningful and important i've got little
children and i want to be able to look
at them in the eye when i'm older and
they're older and say yeah this is what
i did when we saw the climate crisis
coming
but beyond that just the fact that
amazon touches uh everyone's lives all
over the world i get to be a part of it
that's inescapable in the day-to-day
work that i do and frankly that's a
little bit addictive you know it's
pretty exciting
i would advise anyone who was thinking
about joining aws to
go for it because it will provide you
experience that you just can't get
anywhere else it may be that you decide
to come to aws
after joining a small startup that's
fine too
but the experience that you'll get at
amazon won't be anything like anything
you've done anywhere else
